Summary: This is an older motel adjacent to the interstate.  It was clean and the furnishings were serviceable but dated.  The decor in the room looked like it was straight from the 50’s-70’s.  You’re either going to think it’s cool or scratch your head in disbelief. I straddled the fence on that decision, but hey, I was renting not buying.   I arrived in the afternoon and to my surprise, the office was closed.  A poor first impression.  But soon enough, someone showed up and checked me into my room.  There are like only 6 rooms in the whole place so I’m not sure why they need an office. Staff was pleasant and helpful.   I spent two nights here.  There is a lot of street noise but I slept ok.  There are a couple of good restaurants within walking distance and a pub two doors down.

Location is perfect with all kinds of great places to wine and dine all in walking distance, the staff is super friendly ask them anything about the area on where to eat, good beach views, or places to hike and they’ll surely have great recommendations. You can’t beat the price being in Southern California. Over all friendly, clean, and unique. 5 stars.
Room tip: Clean, friendly, and unique. Can’t beat the sunsets!

Summary: Simple, vintage, no frills run by friendly and kind hosts. Fairly represented and priced. A little noise from the highway. Nothing fancy but very hospitable. About 17 mins walk to Califia Beach. 5 mins drive from San Clemente Pier .

My husband and I stayed at the C-VU Motel in mid July for 2 nights. It is a no frills place but I soon discovered that it had a lot going for it. The location is great. It's on a Main Street, and next door to a small grocery store. It is also across the street from the ocean. And while the rooms are small and pretty dated, we don't ever spend much time in the room while we are on vacation.But the very best thing about the C-Vu isJared, the manager. He is amazing. Very friendly and helpful. Anything we needed, including directions and restaurant recommendations, hairdryer etc. It is a funky little place but it is an experience I won't forget, as it was unexpectedly positive!
